poemContent:
Green lines of ink, run down these walls,
Inscribed with tales of tesselation.
Yet I can't quite remember these days,
months, weeks.

I spent with those phreaks,
crazy for chess, endless war scourge.
Chip batty stained jeans, curry stained tops.
Stalemate, check, all that I heard.

It's absurd.

My resting state of general peace has been disrupted
by memories,
of war, an incomprehensable force,
my mind flares up with the harrowing thoughts of black
after white, white after black,
changing my mind, changing it back,
castling down, now king is in check,
battlefield agony, pawns are in wrech.

The small guys are expendable,
black's last and queen's fast,
is all that I remember, all that I learned.

From Chess in M2.
Flip the board. I'm beserk.
